qas.question: In theory how were all polish noblemen viewed?
Was was unique about the dignities?
If one is high in dignities they are also high in what other form?

answers.text: other lords were only peers "de iure"

context: In theory at least, all Polish noblemen were social <a0_0>equals<a0_0/>. Also in theory, they were legal peers. Those who held 'real power' dignities were more privileged but these dignities were <a1_0>not hereditary<a1_0/>. Those who held honorary dignities were higher in '<a2_0>ritual<a2_0/>' hierarchy but these dignities were also granted for a lifetime. Some tenancies became hereditary and went with both privilege and titles. Nobles who were not direct barons of the Crown but held land from <a3_0>other lords were only peers "de iure"<a3_0/>.
